title: Change in the regional distribution of the U.S. population from 1790 to 2019
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 4 lines namely Northeast, Midwest, South, and West. The y axis represents Percentage of population and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Midwest, and West are gradually increasing, Northeast, and South are gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Percentage of population in descending order is: 1. South, 2. Northeast, 3. Midwest, and lastly, 4. West.
Throughout the period, South generally had the highest Percentage of population relative to others with an average of 36.75, and it reached its maximum at 1790 with a value of 49.9.
After South, Northeast overall has the second highest values , with a mean value of 29.1, peaking at 1790.
The botommost line, West,  has a mean of 10.97, and peaked at 2019.
